DataElementConcept.preferredName: Radiation Therapy Beam Treatment Delivery Type
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Treatment of a disease by means of exposure of the target or the whole body to radiation. Radiation therapy is often used as part of curative therapy and occasionally as a component of palliative treatment for cancer. Other uses include total body irradiation prior to transplantation._A group of nearly parallel rays of electromagnetic radiation or a stream of particles._A treatment plan that specifies the dosage, the schedule, and the duration of treatment._The act of the dispensing, applying, or tendering of something to another, such as administration of a medicine._Something distinguishable as an identifiable class based on common qualities.

A group of nearly parallel rays of electromagnetic radiation or a stream of particles.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Events, people, materials and activities uniquely defined by medical imaging.

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: CS: A string of characters with leading or trailing spaces being non-significant consisting of Upper Case, 0-9, SPACE, Underscore. [Standard-based]_Emission or propagation of electromagnetic energy (waves/rays), or the waves/rays themselves; a stream of electromagnetic particles (electrons, neutrons, protons, alpha particles) or a mixture of these. The most common source is the sun._The act of administration._Something distinguishable as an identifiable class based on common qualities.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Treatment used for Quality Assurance rather than patient treatment.
No treatment beam is applied for this RT Beam.  To be used for specifying the gantry, couch, and other machine positions where X-Ray set-up images or measurements are to be taken.
Portal image acquisition with treatment port.
Portal image acquisition with open field.

Being approximately average or within certain limits; conforming with or constituting a norm or standard or level or type or social norm. (NCI): A treatment plan that specifies the dosage, the schedule, and the duration of treatment.

Concepts.definition: Being approximately average or within certain limits; conforming with or constituting a norm or standard or level or type or social norm.
A treatment plan that specifies the dosage, the schedule, and the duration of treatment.
